articles.name: What should I do if the Distributor, Reseller or Enduser are from different regions? [Internal]
articles.title: What should I do if the Distributor, Reseller or Enduser are from different regions? [Internal]
articles.body:
Situation

You have received a manual order, seen a processed order or received a complaint where the regions of the Distributor, Reseller or Enduser do not match.

 

Resolution

GFI Software maintains Distributor Contracts that specify the Territory they are allowed to sell to. The rule is that the Enduser has to be in the contractually designated region of the Distributor. However, the Reseller can be in any country.

Example 1: German Distributor ABC Co has been designated the regions of Germany, Austria, and Switzerland. They have a Reseller in Zimbabwe who wants to sell GFI LanGuard to a customer in Austria.
This is allowed.

Example 2: Canadian Distributor XYZ Co has been designated the regions of Canada and the USA. They have a Reseller in California who wants to sell Exinda to a customer in Mexico.
This is not allowed.

Example 3: Iraqi Distributor 123 Co has been designated the region of Iraq. They have an Enduser in Oman who wants to buy Kerio Connect directly from them as there is no Reseller in the region.
Seek approval from the DSM/Rory James.

articles.name: How can I co-term a subscription? [Internal]
articles.title: How can I co-term a subscription? [Internal]
articles.body:
Situation

You have received a request to have a renewal co-termed to match other subscriptions held by the customer.

 

Resolution

Zuora

Note: it may be helpful to open the previous subscription in Zuora to have it to copy-paste informtaion from

  1. Log in to Zuora and from the left side menu click Subscriptions
  2. On the page that loads click the Add New Subscription button (top right)
  3. In the New Subscription page add:
    • Customer Name and Invoice Owner using the Search button (copy the customer Zuora ID number from the original subscription to use with the search)
    • Initial Term (set it to the desired amount to reach the co-term)
    • Check the Invoice The Subscription Separately box
    • The Accounts Portal CIDs for EndUser, Distributor, and Reseller
    • The PO Number provided by the Distributor
  4. At the bottom of the page add:
    • The Product and the Rate Plan
    • The seat quantities
    • The Partner Discount

      Click Save And Preview
  5. On the Subscription Preview page enter the Contract Effective date and the Preview Start Date and select the End of Term radio button and click Refresh
  6. Check the Term End Date at the top matches the desired co-term date and the Total value at the bottom matches the expected PO value
  7. Click Done to return to the subscription page and click Activate (top right)
  8. In the pop-up notification enter the Contract Effective date and click Save
  9. Once the page goes blank, click refresh to reload it
  10. Make a note of the Subscription Number
  11. At the top right of the page that loads click Create Bill Run
  12. On the Create Bill Run page:
    • copy the Next Renewal Date into the Target Date field
    • make sure to uncheck the Usage box
  13. After making sure the Usage box is unchecked , click the Creat Bill Run button
  14. On the Bill Run page click on the invoice number link
  15. On the invoice page that loads scroll to the bottom and click the View PDF link to preview the invoice to download the invoice PDF and check that everything is as expected
  16. Scroll to the top, click the Post Invoice button (top right), and click Post on the confirmation pop-up
  17. Once the invoice is posted, click the Email Invoice button (top right), and click Send on the confirmation pop-up

Accounts Portal

  1. Go to Manage > Licenses > Search box and enter the license key
  2. Click the ellipses next to the license key > Unlink from a subscription
  3. Click the ellipses next to the license key again > Link to a Subscription
  4. Select the subscription number noted from the Zuora section and click Link
  5. The new subscription page will load, click the Update link to sync the license to the subscription

articles.name: How do I convert a Quote into an Order in the Accounts Portal?
articles.title: How do I convert a Quote into an Order in the Accounts Portal?
articles.body:
Situation

You have won a quote and want to place the relevant order.

 

Action

Note: This feature is only available for certain Distributor accounts

Note: This feature is not available for Expired quotes

Quotes exceeding 2999 seats: if an error is returned when converting a quote for more than 2999 seats, please submit a ticket to our Customer Care team

Exinda/GFI ClearView/GFI FaxMaker Online orders: this feature is under development for Exinda, GFI ClearView or GFI FaxMaker Online orders.

    1. Log in to the Accounts Portal and click Manage > Orders > Quotes, enter the Quote number in the search box and click the link number that appears

      Note: if you do not know the quote number you can search by Customer ID or subscription number or simply scroll through the list
  2. On the Quote page click the green Place Order button at the top
  3. Enter the PO number in the pop-up and click Confirm
  4. The pop-up will disappear revealing the Order Details page where you can monitor the progress of your order (you can close this page and access it again at a later time either by saving the URL or searching for the PO number under Manage > Orders)
    • Processed: the order has been successfully processed and the invoice has been automatically emailed to the on-file accounting address
      Note: if you did not receive the relevant invoice, go to the Orders page, search for the relevant order by PO number, click on the PO number and in the top right you will see the relevant invoice number; submit a request to our Customer Care team to resend you the relevant invoice.
    • Awaiting Approval: the order you placed needs approval to continue
    • Blocked/Error/Rejected: the order encountered an issue and a reason is given; refer to Why was my order not successfully processed? for explanations and solutions

articles.name: How do I generate or update a license in my NFR subscription?
articles.title: How do I generate or update a license in my NFR subscription?
articles.body:
Situation

You are a GFI partner with a valid NFR subscription and need to create a license for a GFI product or update the expiry date of an existing license to match the subscription.

 

Resolution

For video instructions, have a look at NFR Subscription Activation instructions

Important Notes:
- Only one license can be generated per product
- Licenses can only match the expiry of the subscription
- If you are facing issues with your NFR subscription not covered in this article, refer to NFR-related questions or issues

 

Viewing your NFR subscription

  1. Log in to the Accounts Portal and click the Subscription button on the side menu
  2. In the list of subscriptions owned by your company, locate the valid  Unlimited Software NFR subscription
  3. Click ellipses > Details to load the NFR subscription details page

Generating a new license

  1. On the NFR subscription details pages, scroll through the AVAILABLE PRODUCTS section and click the Generate link under the product you would like to create a license for
  2. On the pop-up, confirm the license creation by clicking the Generate button

    Note: the button may say Next if the license has any configuration options (e.g. OS); make the relevant selection, click Next and then click Generate to confirm

  3. Once the generation process is complete, a new pop-up will appear with the license details and the key

Updating an existing license

  1. On the NFR subscription details pages, scroll through the ACTIVE PRODUCTS section; if the expiry date of the relevant product does not match that of the subscription (listed under Next Billing on the left), click Update link under the product
  2. On the confirmation pop-up, click Update to complete the process
  3. Once the generation process is complete, a new pop-up will appear with the license details and the updated key

articles.name: How can I find my GFI product trial key?
articles.title: How can I find my GFI product trial key?
articles.body:
Situation

You need to find your GFI product trial key.

 

Action

Note: If you are looking for a purchased key, refer to How can I find my GFI product license key?

  1. Log in to the Accounts Portal
  2. On the side menu, click My Account then select the My Products tab to load the list of your GFI purchases and trials
  3. Locate the desired product trial and click More Details
  4. On the Licenses page that opens, the trial key will be listed directly under the relevant product name

    Note: Trial keys can only be used once per product. If you receive an error stating that the key has expired despite being newly issued, it means a trial key was already used at some point in the past.

articles.name: How do I handle a Distributor adding or acquiring a new regional entity? [Internal]
articles.title: How do I handle a Distributor adding or acquiring a new regional entity? [Internal]
articles.body:
Situation

A Distributor has contacted you to let you know that they are adding a separate entity to cover a specific region, either as a new addition or an acquisition.

 

Solution

  1. Save the formal notice that the Distributor shared (or ask for it if they did not) in PDF format to the Distributor Contracts folder
  2. Update the Accounts Portal with new Distributor details
  3. Update Zuora with new Distributor details
  4. Notify Central Finance at gficollections@gfi.com, forwarding the relevant email thread/notice
  5. Notify the regional DSM to update the GFI Distributors Database with new Distributor details

articles.name: Process for Requesting an "Authorized Partner" Letter from GFI
articles.title: Process for Requesting an "Authorized Partner" Letter from GFI
articles.body:
Dear Partners,

To streamline the process of obtaining an "Authorized Partner" Letter, please follow these steps:

1. Access the partner letter template:
(https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ORxGwWxNxeqM_DfcbDkhmPiJoK7dhCkusnwNvM1pFuk/edit?usp=sharing)

2. Make a copy of the document:
- Click "File" > "Make a copy" in Google Docs
- Save the copy with your company name in the title

3. Fill in the required information:
- Replace all bracketed placeholders with your specific details
- Ensure all sections are completed accurately

4. Convert to PDF:
- Click "File" > "Download" > "PDF Document (.pdf)"

5. Submit the completed letter:
- Open a new support ticket at https://customercare.gfi.com/hc/en-us/requests/new
- Attach the PDF version of your completed partner letter
- Include "Partner Letter Request" in the subject line

Our team will review your submission, sign the letter, and return it to you via the support ticket.

If you have any questions or need assistance, please don't hesitate to contact our support team.

Thank you for your cooperation.

Best regards,
Partner Support Team

articles.name: How do I create a trial license for a customer?
articles.title: How do I create a trial license for a customer?
articles.body:
Situation

You have a potential or existing customer who wishes to try out a GFI Software product and want to provide them with a trial license key.

 

Resolution

Note: This is only actionable using a Reseller or Distributor account

  1. Log in to the Accounts Portal

  2. Go to Manage > Licenses > gear icon > New License


  3. Select the product, the product version, and the template in the order shown below > click Next


  4. Use the Find an Enduser, Find a Reseller, and Find a Distributor fields to search for the relevant accounts using either their email, their email domain preceded by an "@" (e.g. @gfi.com) or
    their Customer ID (CID) if you know it > click Next

    (the Find a Distributor field is only editable using a Distributor account)

    If you cannot find an account
    1. It does not exist: follow the instructions in How do I create a Reseller account? (Distributors only) or How do I create an Enduser Account?
    2. It is not visible to you: if you are certain the account exists but you cannot see it, submit a visibility request to our Customer Care team.

  5. On the final confirmation page click Finish


  6. You will be presented with the license detail page, including the trial key listed under the product name
  7. Go to the GFI UpgradeCenter to find and download the latest product version for the trial

articles.name: Why won't Google Meet let me use Visual Effects to change my background? [Internal]
articles.title: Why won't Google Meet let me use Visual Effects to change my background? [Internal]
articles.body:
Situation

Using your Chromium-based browser you are met with the following error when trying to use the Visual Effects setting to change your background, despite hardware acceleration being enabled.

 

Resolution

  1. Visit your browser's flags page, usually available at the URL {browser.name}://flags/ (e.g. for Brave it would be brave://flags/)
  2. Search for Override software rendering list and set it to Enabled
  3. Relaunch your browser

articles.name: How do I create a Quote for Exinda or GFI ClearView in the Accounts Portal?
articles.title: How do I create a Quote for Exinda or GFI ClearView in the Accounts Portal?
articles.body:
Situation

You need to create a quotation PDF before placing an order.

 

Action

Note: This feature is only available for certain Distributor accounts

EUC: If you have not provided us with the new EUC for the relevant Enduser, please make sure to submit it as soon as possible to avoid delays during the ordering process. Click here for more details and to download the latest blank EUC.

  1. Log in to the Accounts Portal and follow the regular Exinda/GFI ClearView order process for your order
    Note: in step 3 make sure to change the Contract Effective Date to the current date of expiry because that is the date the license will be renewed from
  2. Instead of completing the order in step 4 click on Publish Quote

    Note: if you make changes in step 4 (for example, the quantity of one of the items), click the Preview Order button for the values to be updated and the Publish Quote button will reappear.
  3. On the confirmation dialogue, click Confirm then Go to Quote
  4. On the page that opens click Download Quote to download the PDF
  5. Make a note of the quote number (top right) for future reference

Note: You can find your order by going to Manage > Orders > Quotes button and using the search box to enter the quote number.

If you do not remember your quote number, leave the search box blank and scroll through the list to locate it.

For other GFI products, there is an option to convert a quote directly into an order. This feature is currently under development for Exinda, GFI ClearView and GFI FaxMaker Online orders.

articles.name: How do I place an order for Exinda or GFI ClearView?
articles.title: How do I place an order for Exinda or GFI ClearView?
articles.body:
Situation

You need to place an order for new business or for the renewal of Exinda or GFI ClearView

Important Note: All orders (including new subscriptions, renewals, upgrades, and add-ons) are placed by Distributors only, using the GFI Web Shop.

If you are a Reseller, please place your order with a Distributor in your area.

If you are an End user, please place your order with a Reseller in your area.

 

Resolution

EUC: If you have not provided us with the new EUC for the relevant Enduser, please make sure to submit it as soon as possible to avoid delays during the ordering process. Click here for more details and to download the latest blank EUC.

Step 1: Update or Create

  1. Log in to the GFI Accounts Portal (or if you are already logged in, click here: GFI Web Shop)
  2. Click on the Webshop button to go to step 1 of the 4-step order process
  3. Click on Create a new subscription (even if you are ordering a renewal, Exinda/GFI ClearView orders always create a new subscription; the order will go based on the provided Serial Number(s) or Host ID(s) in step 4).

Note: Although it is possible to try using the Update an existing subscription and enter the subscription number in the search field, this will not always return results for Exinda/GFI ClearView and a new subscription will always be created either way. It is recommended to always use Create a new subscription

 

Step 2: Customer Tier

  1. Use the Find an enduser and Find a reseller fields to search for the relevant accounts using either their email , their email domain preceded by an "@" (e.g. @gfi.com) or their Customer ID (CID) if you know it
  2. Once you have found the relevant account, click on it to set the selection, and click Next
    Note: if you select the wrong account by mistake, click the x in the top right corner of the incorrect account to clear the selection and search again

If you cannot find an account
1. It does not exist: follow the instructions in How do I create a Reseller account? (Distributors only) or How do I create an Enduser Account?
2. It is not visible to you: if you are certain the account exists but you cannot see it, submit a visibility request to our Customer Care team.

 

Step 3: Configure

  1.  Under Term Length select the number of months 12/24/36
    Important Note: Orders with an irregular number of months (i.e. not 12/24/36) will be rejected unless preapproved
  2. Enable the switches on each option as needed
    • For shaping you can add combinations and amend the quantities in step 4.
      For example, if you have device A with 550MB shaping and device B with 1.5GB shaping, you can enable switches 50MB, 500MB, 1GB and in step 4 increase the quantity for 500MB to 2:
      • A: 50MB + 500MB = 550MB
      • B:  500MB + 1GB = 1.5GB 
  3. Add any special instructions, Deal Desks, important notes, exceptions or explanations in the Special Instructions box
  4. Click Next

 

Step 4: Preview

Exinda/ClearView Orders: The Serial Number(s)/Host ID(s), respectively, for all relevant instances must be provided for the order to be processed. A mandatory field will appear in the bottom left of the Preview page for these orders.

  1. The preview page will display:
    • All the order data set from the previous steps
    • Itemised pricing information
    • The Promo Codes field for applying pre-approved discounts for government, education, charity or non-profit organisations
    • The total order value
  2. Enter the Serial Number(s) and/or Host ID(s) of all relevant instances in the Serial Numbers box (bottom left) separated by commas
  3. Edit the quantities in the QUANTITY column as needed
  4. Click the blue Preview Order button (bottom right) for the values to be updated
  5. Once you have confirmed that everything is as expected, click the blue Place Order button (bottom right)
  6. In the pop-up, enter your purchase order number in the PO Number field and click Confirm
  7. Once the order has been successfully submitted you will see the following pop-up message

Note: Unlike orders for other GFI products, Exinda and GFI ClearView orders will not be visible in the Accounts Portal. You will receive email notifications concerning the progress of your order.

articles.name: How do I place an order for a new MSP or SaaS subscription?
articles.title: How do I place an order for a new MSP or SaaS subscription?
articles.body:
Situation

You need to place an order for a new MSP or SaaS subscription.

Important Note: All orders (including new subscriptions, renewals, upgrades, and add-ons) are placed by Distributors only, using the GFI Web Shop.

If you are a Reseller, please place your order with a Distributor in your area.

If you are an End user, please place your order with a Reseller in your area.

 

Resolution

For video instructions, have a look at this Webshop Tutorial from our Partner Portal Academy's Training Courses.

Step 1: Create

  1. Log in to the GFI Accounts Portal (or if you are already logged in, click here: GFI Web Shop)
  2. Click on the Webshop button to go to step 1 of the 4-step order process
  3. Select Create a new subscription
  4. Select the desired product from the drop-down menu:
    • GFI LanGuard MSP
      or
    • Kerio SaaS
  5. Click Next:

  

 

Step 2: Customer Tier

  1. Use the Find a reseller field to search for the relevant Reseller account using either their email , their email domain preceded by an "@" (e.g. @gfi.com) or their Customer ID (CID) if you know it
  2. Once you have found the relevant account, click on it and click Next

Important note: Do not enter an Enduser as this is never applicable to MSP/SaaS subscriptions

If you cannot find an account
1. It does not exist: follow the instructions in How do I create a Reseller account? (Distributors only) or How do I create an Enduser Account?
2. It is not visible to you: if you are certain the account exists but you cannot see it, submit a visibility request to our Customer Care team.

 

Step 3: Configure

  1. Click Term Length and select Monthly (it is the only choice)
  2. The Contract Effective Date will automatically be set to the first of the month and should not be altered
  3. Depending on the product select the version:
    • Kerio Saas Monthly Subscription (only option available)
    • GFI LanGuard Network Audit subscription for MSPs (based on usage) 
    • GFI LanGuard Network Audit subscription for MSPs - Unlimited (based on a fixed monthly rate)
  4. Click Next

   

 

Step 4: Preview

  1. The preview page will display:
    • All the order data set from the previous steps
    • Itemised pricing information
    • The total order value (for GFI LanGuard Network Audit subscription for MSPs - Unlimited only)
  2. Once you have confirmed that everything is as expected, click Place Order
  3. Enter your purchase order number in the pop-up box PO Number field
  4. Click Confirm

  • Once the order has been successfully submitted, click Go to Order on the confirmation pop-up
  • On the Order Details page you can monitor the progress of your order (you can close this page and access it again at a later time either by saving the URL or searching for the PO number under Manage > Orders)
    • Processed: the order has been successfully processed and the invoice has been automatically emailed to the on-file accounting address
      Note: if you did not receive the relevant invoice, go to the Orders page, search for the relevant order by PO number, click on the PO number and in the top right you will see the relevant invoice number; submit a request to our Customer Care team to resend you the relevant invoice.
    • Awaiting Approval: the order you placed needs approval to continue
    • Blocked/Error/Rejected: the order encountered an issue and a reason is given; refer to Why was my order not successfully processed? for explanations and solutions

articles.name: How do I deal with tickets concerning the MyKerio EOL action? [Internal]
articles.title: How do I deal with tickets concerning the MyKerio EOL action? [Internal]
articles.body:
Situation

MyKerio has reached its End of Life (EOL). After being fully deprecated you have received customer/partner questions or complaints.

 

Resolution

Below are some common questions or complaints you may encounter and how to deal with them.

Note: if none of the below cover your ticket, refer to the Blockers sheet. If the answer is not there either, add it on a new row and keep an eye out for a response.

 

Technical issues or bugs, e.g. I cannot create VLAN or I cannot connect an appliance

Refer the requester to CS using the Deflect.Technical.Request macro as normal.

Feature suggestions

Check the Feature Requests sheet to see if it is already listed and add it if it is not. Then use the Confirm.AppManager.Feature.Request macro to respond to the ticket.

Note: responses to all the below are available as part of the Deflect.AppManager macro. Remember to remove any irrelevant text before replying.

Complaints about user management

Upcoming releases will enhance this. For urgent requests they should open a ticket with CS.

Complaints about slowness

Each new release will come with an increase in speed with the ultimate goal of matching MyKerio.

Questions about backup

  • I need a backup: this is no longer possible
  • What will happen to all my data: all data will be deleted
  • GFI AppManager has no backup feature: yes, it does but it is not enabled by default as it requires a backup location to be selected

Kerio Operator is not in AppManager

Kerio Operator has been EOE (End of Engineering) for quite some time, meaning that although it is available for use, it no longer receives any updates or fixes. As such it has not been included in GFI AppManager.

Requester is still getting alerts from MyKerio

The platform is being shut down in stages so the alerts will cease once this has been fully completed.

articles.name: How can I see a list of upcoming renewals (expiring subscriptions)?
articles.title: How can I see a list of upcoming renewals (expiring subscriptions)?
articles.body:
Situation

You did not receive your monthly automated report on upcoming renewals or you would like to see which subscriptions are expiring during a specific date range.

 

Resolution

  1. Log in to the Accounts Portal, go to Manage > Subscriptions and click on the filter button
  2. In the slide-in window, click Subscription and click the Next Billing Date Range field to select the desired date range
  3. Once selected, click Apply and the list of subscriptions expiring during that date range will be listed

articles.name: What do I do if a distributor is acquired by another entity?
articles.title: What do I do if a distributor is acquired by another entity?
articles.body:
Situation

You have been informed by a Distributor that their company has been acquired by a different entity and you need to update all records to match this change.

 

Resolution

  1. Distributors must share formal notice of the acquisition. This notice must be saved in PDF form (we already have this for Infinigate via email. Find that email and upload it in the correct folder.)
  2. Update Accounts portal with new Distributor Name and details
  3. Update Zuora with new details
  4. Notify Central finance by writing to gficollections@gfi.com. Forward the email thread/ notice etc.
  5. Update GFI.Distributor Database with new details ( to be done by DSM)

articles.name: How do I use macros in Zendesk? [Internal]
articles.title: How do I use macros in Zendesk? [Internal]
articles.body:
Overview

You are an agent working the GFI Customer Care Zendesk queue and would like to streamline your work by using macros.

 

Details

The below macros are available in the GFI Customer Care Zendesk. To apply a macro:

  1. Click the Apply macro button available at the bottom left of each ticket you open
  2. From the menu that pops up, click on the desired macro to apply it

    Note: to see what a macro does before selecting it, you can click the eye icon visible at the end of the row of the macro you hover the mouse cursor over

List of available macros

Important notes:

  • All macros automatically assign the ticket to the current user; reassign if necessary
  • All macros start with "Dear Customer/Dear Team/Dear Partner"; use the requester's name when possible
  • For Confirm PO macros make sure the Subscription Number, PO Number, Invoice, and Product License Key fields have been filled in before using
  • Any manual actions are denoted with [INSTRUCTIONS: ***] and should always be deleted before posting
  • Any manual text is denoted by descriptive_bold_text_with_underscores and should always be replaced or deleted before posting
Name Description Side Conversation Attachment Status
ACK.Personal Acknowledges the ticket in the first person singular. Use this when you will work on the ticket later N/A N/A Open
ACK.PO Acknowledges receipt of a valid manual PO (i.e. Exinda, FMO, exceptions) N/A N/A Open
ACK.Team Acknowledges the ticket in the second person plural. Use this when you will assign the ticket to a colleague to work on later N/A N/A Open
Confirm.Action Confirms completion with 4 most common texts to choose from N/A N/A Solved
Confirm.New.Partner Confirms addition of new partner to Requester with intro info

Sends notification to Rory including ticket number and all the new partner info

 N/A Solved
Confirm.New.Partner.NFR Confirms addition of new partner to Requester with intro info including NFR

Sends notification to Rory including ticket number and all the new partner info and mentions NFR was provided

 N/A Solved
Confirm.Order.Rejection.Reason Confirms why an order was rejected, provides possible solution and refers to Errors KBA. N/A N/A Solved
Confirm.PO.ClearView Confirms successful processing of ClearView order

Confirmation email with unique subject including the invoice, PO, sub and ticket number; invoice PDF + recipient emails need to be manually added

 N/A Solved
Confirm.PO.Exinda Confirms successful processing of Exinda order

Confirmation email with unique subject including the invoice, PO, sub and ticket number; invoice PDF + Exinda cert + recipient emails need to be manually added

 N/A Solved
Confirm.PO.FMO Confirms successful processing of FMO order including PO and invoice numbers N/A N/A Solved
Confirm.PO.NFR Confirms successful processing of NFR additional seats order including PO and invoice numbers; seats have to be added manually N/A N/A Solved
Deflect.Direct.Renewal.Request

Deflects quotation or renewal requests from customers to resellers and from resellers to distributors; irrelevant line needs to be deleted and distributor includes Climb by default as they are the most popular

 N/A N/A Solved
Deflect.EULA Deflects license transfer requests by referring to our EULA + link to our legal page N/A N/A Solved
Deflect.Kerio.OS Deflects Kerio OS change tickets to relevant KBA N/A N/A Solved
Deflect.PO Deflects manual PO requests to the Web Shop + instructional KBA N/A N/A Solved
Deflect.PO.Exinda Deflects manual PO requests to the Web Shop + instructional KBA + special instructions for Exinda N/A EUC template Solved
Deflect.Quote Deflects manual quote requests to instructional KBA N/A N/A Solved
Deflect.Quote.Exinda Deflects manual quote requests to instructional KBA + special instructions for Exinda N/A EUC template Solved
Deflect.RADAR.Beta Deflects requests for RADAR waiting list to the relevant form N/A N/A Solved
Deflect.SPAM Closes spam with public reply to self so metrics don't suffer N/A N/A Solved
Deflect.Technical.Request Deflects technical requests to CS N/A N/A Solved
Done Sets ticket to solved with the text "Done" N/A N/A Solved
Request.EUC Confirms order receipt and requests EUC N/A EUC template On-hold
Request.Info Requests missing info N/A N/A Pending

articles.name: How do I download my Kerio key file and manually apply it to my instance?
articles.title: How do I download my Kerio key file and manually apply it to my instance?
articles.body:
Situation

You recently purchased or a change was recently made to your Kerio product. When entering your license number into your Kerio instance it does not reflect the expected information (expiry, seats, etc) or you receive an error.

 

Resolution

Note: If the error says that the license is not for this operating system or not for this hardware, refer to How can I update my Kerio Connect or Kerio Control OS or Hardware model? before proceeding

 

Downloading the license key file

  1. Go to the Kerio Product registration page enter the license number and the captcha code and click Next


  2. Check that the relevant license information is displayed and click Next
    Note: if the information is incorrect, stop here and submit a ticket to our Customer Care team


  3. Check your company info, check the Privacy Policy Terms box and click Next


  4. Check the Operating system and Language and click Next
    Note: for Kerio Control you can also enter the hardware Serial number


  5. Check the Overview of the entered information and click Finish


  6. To download the license key file click Download the License

Importing the key file in Kerio Connect

  1. Open the Kerio Connect Administration console
  2. On the Dashboard click the Install license... link (bottom right)
  3. Click Browse to select the license.key file you downloaded previously
  4. Click OK to complete the process

Importing the key file in Kerio Control

  1. Open the Kerio Control Administration interface
  2. On the Dashboard click the Configuration Assistant button (bottom right)
  3. Click Register product or Update license info (this changes if it is a new instance)
  4. In the registration window that opens click the Register offline by license file link (bottom right)
  5. Click Browse to select the license.key file you downloaded previously and click Next
  6. Follow the registration wizard to complete the process

articles.name: How can I see how many active subscriptions are under my partner account?
articles.title: How can I see how many active subscriptions are under my partner account?
articles.body:
Situation

You have a partner account and you would like to see how many subscriptions are linked to your account.

 

Resolution

  1. Log in to the Accounts Portal, go to Manage > Subscriptions and in the search bar enter your Customer Id (CID)
    Note: if you do not know your CID, you can find it on the Accounts Portal Home page listed under your avatar (on the left)

  2. Click the filter button

  3. Extend the Subscription section:
    • under Subscription Status select Active
    • under Next Billing Date Range select a date range starting from today and ending far into the future
  4. Click Apply
  5. The total number of subscriptions will be listed in parentheses next to the Subscriptions title on the left

articles.name: How can I see GFI FaxMaker Online (FMO) subscription details in the GFI Accounts Portal?
articles.title: How can I see GFI FaxMaker Online (FMO) subscription details in the GFI Accounts Portal?
articles.body:
Situation

You want to see the number of Users, Outbound Only Users, DIDs Assigned, and DIDs Available under an GFI FaxMaker Online (FMO) subscription in the Accounts Portal.

 

Action

The steps are different depending on your account type.

If you are an Enduser

  1. Login to the Accounts Portal and click My Account from the side menu
  2. Under the GFI FaxMaker Online listing click the More Details link
  3. Select the Overview tab; the information is listed on the bottom left under Product Details
  4. Click on the View DIDs Assigned and the View DIDs Available links to see a list of the relevant numbers

If you are a Partner

  1. Login to the Accounts Portal and click Manage from the side menu to be taken to the Licenses tab
  2. In the search box on the right, enter the Enduser name or customer ID (CID) number  and press Enter
  3. Click on the relevant GFI FaxMaker Online license for the slide-in pop-up to appear
  4. Click the View link in the top right
  5. On the Overview page that loads the information is listed on the bottom left under Product Details
  6. Click on the View DIDs Assigned and the View DIDs Available links to see a list of the relevant numbers

articles.title: GFI CC New Hire Resources & Reading [Internal]
articles.body:
Resources

A list of online resources and tools needed for all CC-related work.

Accounts Portal (AP)

The frontend accounts, licensing, subscription, and order portal to which our partners and customers have access to as well. All orders are placed by our partners using the Web Shop available in the AP.
https://accounts.gfi.com/Home 

Zuora

Our billing and invoicing platform, directly linked to the AP.
https://www.zuora.com/apps/newlogin.do

GFI Zendesk

Our ticket handling system, where all CC/SOP requests are handled (we never use email/phone).
https://gfillc.zendesk.com/agent/dashboard

Customer Care Center

Where partners and customers can submit a request directly to us which we will pick up through GFI Zendesk. It also houses our publicly accessible (and internal) knowledge base articles which visitors can use to self-serve, and our AI-powered bot, Opera.
https://customercare.gfi.com/hc/en-us

GFIBU Confluence

Internal knowledge articles (currently being migrated to Zendesk).
https://trilogy-confluence.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/GFIBU/overview

KISS

The licensing portal for all Kerio products. Partners and customers are generally not aware of this and do not have access.
https://secure.kerio.com/private/

EBS

Our internal Jive instance.

Customer Support (CS)

Where you can find technical knowledgebase articles or deflect customers to if they have a technical query. Customers often confuse Customer Care (CC) with CS but it is CS for technical support.

For submitting relevant requests.

articles.name: How do I process an OEM royalties invoice?
articles.title: How do I process an OEM royalties invoice?
articles.body:
Situation

You will receive a request from the relevant partner similar to"Please find attached the GFI report for Q1 2024. Please send the invoice." A common one is SysAid.

 

Resolution

  1. Open the attachment and check the amount only for the requested quarter.
  2. Find the relevant partner in Zuora and click Create Invoice
  3. Add a comment similar to "Q1 2024 - GFI LanGuard - OEM"
  4. Click Search Exisiting Products > GFI LanGuard > GFI LanGuard OEM > Add
  5. Enter the Price (USD), Start Date, and End Date to match the quarter and click Save
  6. Check everything and click Create Invoice
  7. Click View Invoice PDF to check the invoice before posting it; it should look similar to this
  8. Click Post Invoice followed by Email Invoice

articles.name: What is an End-User Certificate (EUC) and how do I fill it in?
articles.title: What is an End-User Certificate (EUC) and how do I fill it in?
articles.body:
Overview

You have been asked to fill in and sign an EUC and would like to know more details about it.

 

Details

What is it?

An End-User Certificate (EUC) is a crucial document required in international transactions involving sensitive technology, equipment, or software. The EUC verifies the identity and intentions of the final recipients of the exported items. It serves to assure that these items are used solely for the purposes declared by the buyer, and that they comply with legal and regulatory export controls. This certification is vital for preventing the misuse or diversion of sensitive goods to unauthorized entities or activities. 

 

I am a US End Customer. Do I need to sign this document?

Yes, you need to sign the EUC when purchasing Exinda and GFI Clearview. This is to certify that the software will not be exported by you outside of US.

 

Where do I find the EUC template to fill in?

One should already have been sent to you but if you cannot locate it, it is also attached at the bottom of this article.

 

How do I fill it in?

First paragraph

In the first paragraph, on the empty line after "BUYER", add the name of the company the EUC is for:

 

Bottom of the document

At the bottom of the page, there are 4 items all of which need to be added:

  • Signature (on behalf of Buyer): The signature of the representative of the Buyer company
  • Date: The date the EUC was signed
  • Buyer’s Signatory Name: The full name and surname of the representative of the Buyer that is signing the EUC
  • Buyer’s Signatory Job Title: The full job title of the representative of the Buyer company

articles.name: How do I temporarily enable a deprecated product in Zuora? [Internal]
articles.title: How do I temporarily enable a deprecated product in Zuora? [Internal]
articles.body:
Situation

You have received a special order for a deprecated/disabled product with special approval.

 

Resolution

  1. Go to the Zuora Product Catalog
  2. Locate the relevant product and click on it
  3. Locate the charge group and click on the pencil icon (not the individual SKU you want to reenable)
  4. Make a note of the Effective End Date then change it to tomorrow and click Save:
  5. Process the order as needed, then repeat the above process, setting the date to the original one noted in step 4 and clicking Save

Note: if the product needs to be reenabled for a specific period of time, set the Effective End Date in step 4 to the desired end date and it will be disabled automatically

articles.name: How can I find my GFI product license key?
articles.title: How can I find my GFI product license key?
articles.body:
Situation

You need to find your GFI product license key.

 

Action

Note: If you are looking for a trial key, refer to How can I find my GFI product trial key?

  2. On the side menu, click Subscription to load the list of your GFI subscriptions

You want to test GFI products before committing to a purchase, ensuring it meets your needs.

Once registered, you can activate the trial license immediately, giving you full access to the product's features free for 30 days.

articles.name: Temporary Suspensions Removals [Internal]
articles.title: Temporary Suspensions Removals [Internal]
articles.body:
This article is based on Temporary Suspensions Removals but has been rewritten for relevance

Situation

A customer has complained that they cannot submit a Technical Support ticket, saying they receive the following automated message:

"We are sorry to inform you that your account has been suspended due to non-payment of outstanding invoices because of which this ticket has been closed. Please have your Finance department pay the invoices to continue receiving support. For more information, they can contact us via our portal https://central-finance.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/requests/new."

 

Resolution

Central Finance uses the Finance Support Suspension Tracker to add or remove suspensions.

Important Note: companies should never be added to the list, only the suspension flag should be added/removed

There are some cases where you may be asked to temporarily lift the ban for the customer:

  1. Open the Finance Support Suspension Tracker and find the relevant entry using the search feature:
    • To suspend an account set:
      • column Status = suspend
      • column ZD Suspended = TRUE or blank
    • To remove the suspension set:
      • column Status = remove
      • column 7 Day = TRUE
      • column Timestamp = today's date
  2. To apply the action click the ZD Suspend button

    the Running script button will appear

    and once the action is completed the confirmation dialogue will pop up

articles.name: What status should I set my ticket to? [Internal]
articles.title: What status should I set my ticket to? [Internal]
articles.body:
Overview

This guide will explain what each Zendesk ticket status means, when you should use it, and what to expect.

 

Details

New

  • Meaning: the ticket is newly opened and is unassigned
  • When to use: this status is set automatically (you cannot set it)
  • What to expect: the ticket will remain in this status perpetually until an agent actions it

Open

  • Meaning: the ticket is pending action
  • When to use: you are assigning tickets to yourself that you have not actioned; it is also set automatically when a Pending/On-hold/Solved requester/side conversation receives a reply
  • What to expect: the ticket will remain in this status until an agent actions it

Pending

  • Meaning: the ticket is pending a response from the requester
  • When to use: this status should never be used
  • What to expect: the ticket will remain in this status for 7 days and then automatically move to Solved

Note: the Pending status should never be used.

On-hold

  • Meaning: the ticket is blocked waiting on a third party
  • When to use: you have updated the requester that the ticket is being worked on and you are waiting for a third party to unblock you
  • What to expect: the ticket will remain in this status for 7 days and then automatically move to Open

Solved

  • Meaning: the ticket has been Solved
  • When to use: you have provided a solution and (where relevant) updated the requester
  • What to expect: the ticket will remain in this status for 7 days and then automatically move to Closed

articles.name: How do I work on Customer Care tickets in Zendesk? [Internal]
articles.title: How do I work on Customer Care tickets in Zendesk? [Internal]
articles.body:
Overview

You are an agent that has been assigned to work the GFI Customer Care Zendesk queue.

 

Details

Note: For details on how to work tickets using macros, have a look at How do I use macros in Zendesk?

The following ergonomic system has been devised to optimise efficiency and requester satisfaction. Go to the Ticket Dashboard and follow these steps:

  1. Check the views The Queue and Open for Priority: Urgent tickets and work them
  2. After all urgent tickets are done, return to The Queue and click the Play button (top right)

    Note: the Play function works by showing you the first ticket in the queue, and each time you click the Next or the Submit as... button (bottom right) it automatically takes you to the next ticket
  3. Work the tickets in the following way:
    • If the ticket is easily workable (in about 2 mins):
      • click the take it link (top left)
      • work the ticket
      • click Submit as... and select the relevant status
    • If the ticket will take more time, click the take it link (top left) send a Public reply to thank the requester, reassure that their ticket is being worked on, click Submit as Open
      Note: never promise a solution, never specify an amount of time
    • If the ticket needs to be handled by another agent, select the relevant agent from the Assignee* dropdown menu (top left), send a Public reply to thank the requester, reassure that their ticket is being worked on, click Submit as Open
    • If the ticket is actually urgent and was mismarked, set the Priority field to Urgent and work the ticket immediately
  4. Leave some time at the end of your shift to run through the steps above, leaving the queue empty before you finish for the day

Your Open tickets queue will always be grouped by priority and ordered by latest update (oldest first) meaning you should see your previously Open tickets before the ones you recently picked up from the queue. Use your best judgement to move through and prioritise your Open tickets.

 

Ticket Status

  • New: the ticket is unassigned and untouched
  • Open: you are currently working on the ticket
    • the ticket will remain perpetually in this status unless changed by you
  • On-hold: you need to investigate further or are waiting for a reply from another team
    • the ticket will re-Open after 7 days to remind you to follow up
  • Pending: you need more information from the requester to provide a solution
    • the ticket will auto-Solve after 7 days
  • Solved: you have provided a solution to the requester
    • the ticket will auto-Close after 7 days
  • Closed: the ticket can no longer be actioned
    • if the requester replies to it a follow-up ticket is automatically created

articles.name: Not For Resale (NFR) subscription FAQ
articles.title: Not For Resale (NFR) subscription FAQ
articles.body:
What is an NFR subscription?

As part of our ongoing commitment to enable our partners to succeed, we provide NFR (Not For Resale) subscriptions at no cost. These subscriptions are designed for partners to use internally for testing, development, demonstration, and training purposes. While NFR subscriptions cannot be resold or transferred to customers, they give partners hands-on experience with the product to better serve their clients. Our NFR subscriptions include:

  • Full product access for internal use
  • Support for demonstration and training activities
  • The ability to test and validate solutions
  • A practical way to build expertise with our platforms

What are the eligibility requirements for receiving an NFR subscription?

For successful partners with active customer subscriptions, we provide a complimentary 12-month NFR subscription set to expire on January 31 of the following year.

Partners in the early stages of their journey with us receive a 3-month NFR subscription to support their growth. These 3-month subscriptions may be extended depending on status.

If you are new to GFI Software and have successfully completed the GFI Portfolio Training Course and Exam (this is a mandatory prerequisite) you can request an NFR subscription by clicking the Request NFR licenses button on this page.

I have a new NFR subscription but no licenses. My NFR subscription was renewed but the licenses were not. Why?

NFR licenses (not to be confused with the subscription that hosts them) are not automatically generated or updated. To generate licenses on your new NFR subscription or update licenses on your newly renewed NFR subscription, follow the instructions in How do I generate or update a license in my NFR subscription?

For any other NFR-related concerns

If you have any questions that were not answered or are facing any NFR subscription-related issues, feel free to contact the Customer Care team.

articles.name: Why was my order not successfully processed? (Common Errors)
articles.title: Why was my order not successfully processed? (Common Errors)
articles.body:
Situation

Your order reflects the status Blocked, Error or Rejected. On the Orders Details page 

 

Resolution

Rejected

If your order has been Rejected, you should have received a notification explaining why. Please follow the instructions in the notification to resubmit the order for processing.

Blocked/Error

If your order is showing Blocked or Error refer to the message that accompanies it and check below for a solution. If the message is not listed below, submit a request to our Customer Care team for further assistance.

  • 1002 : Cannot identify order business type
  • 1002 : Item CYRENU / KASPRENU / CYRENREN / KASPREN (or similar) not found in the template
  • 1002 : Main item quantity is invalid
  • 70005 : The Zip Code is required for the selected country
  • 51010320 : 'billToContact.city' length must be between 0 and 40
  • 53500020 : The Contract effective date should not be later than the term end date of the basic subscription / The term end date in the current term should be later than the last amendment customer acceptance date
  • 53500030 : The product rate plan for this subscription is not available with currency: 'AUD/EUR/GBP'.
  • An exception has been encountered
  • Broker account not found
  • Cannot create subscription without main item
  • EdiAckWorker >> Ack 855 generated and sent
  • Out of range: Quantity needs to be between 25 and 2999, excluding the range between XXXX and XXXX
  • Owner account must be enduser
  • PO number 'xxxxxxxxxxxxx' for invoice owner [xxxxxxx] already exists in the system
  • The operation was canceled
  • This order has pending licenses
  • The submitted order price does not match the actual price for this order (Actual order value: X,XXX.XX)
  • Unhandled exception 'An error occurred while updating the entries. See the inner exception for details.'.

1002 : Cannot identify order business type

An invalid SKU or an invalid SKU - pricing/settings combination was submitted (usually via API). Reprocess the order using the correct SKU.

 

1002 : Item CYRENU / KASPRENU / CYRENREN / KASPREN (or similar) not found in the template

An order was submitted for a subscription that has the deprecated Cyren or Kaspersky anti-virus engine add-on enabled. Submit a request to our Customer Care team to remove the add-on before resubmitting.

 

1002 : Main item quantity is invalid

An invalid number of seats was submitted. Resubmit the order with a valid number of seats.

 

70005 : The Zip Code is required for the selected country

Enter the relevant ZIP code for either the Enduser or Reseller account and Retry the order.

 

51010320 : 'billToContact.city' length must be between 0 and 40

The City field in the Enduser's contact information is missing or too long. Edit the Enduser account details in the GFI Accounts Portal accordingly and click Try Again.

 

53500020 : The Contract effective date should not be later than the term end date of the basic subscription / The term end date in the current term should be later than the last amendment customer acceptance date

The subscription-license combo does not match or is corrupted. Submit a request to have this corrected so the order can be processed (in some cases this may mean having the license migrated to a different subscription).

 

53500030 : The product rate plan for this subscription is not available with currency: 'AUD/EUR/GBP'.

The subscription is in a non-USD currency (likely an old subscription). Submit a request to our Customer Care team to have the license migrated to a new subscription.

 

An exception has been encountered

A nondescript error has occurred. Waiting a little (30-60 mins) and clicking the Try Again button should result in the order being processed.

 

Broker account not found

The Reseller account does not exist. Create/Find the Reseller, click Edit to find the subscription number and process the order from scratch.

 

Cannot create subscription without main item

The items listed in the order, do not include the main subscription item. This happens when:

  1. trying to renew only one product from an Unlimited subscription without first requesting a migration first; submit a migration request to our Customer Care team.
  2. trying to renew only an addon without renewing the main subscription; cancel the order and renew the main subscription and the addon in the same order. Only if the main subscription order has already been separately processed, submit a request to our Customer Care team.

 

EdiAckWorker >> Ack 855 generated and sent

Not an error per se. This is an acknowledgement message generated by EDI. To find the relevant error message, check the order’s History tab.

 

Out of range: Quantity needs to be between 25 and 2999, excluding the range between XXXX and XXXX

The Web Shop Configure page has a maximum seat count of 2999. If you need to order more seats, enter the highest allowable amount (usually 2999) and edit for the desired amount on the final Preview page. This works for all products.

 

Owner account must be enduser

The submitted Owner is not an Enduser account and must be changed accordingly for the order to go through. Edit the order, add the EndUser, and reprocess. If the Enduser account does not exist, you can create one in 4 easy steps.

 

PO number 'xxxxxxxxxxxxx' for invoice owner [xxxxxxx] already exists in the system

This denotes that an order with the same PO number has already been processed by you. If this occurs only once, it can be ignored. If more than one, it is most likely your API system is stuck retrying the same order over again and your orders list will be spammed by endless rejection entries until it is resolved by your tech team. This can also happen if you manually keep trying to place the same order after it has already been processed.

 

The operation was canceled

The subscription does not have a license. Navigate to the subscription Overview page and click the Generate link. Then return to the order page and click Try Again.

 

This order has pending licenses

Go to the relevant subscription and check if there is a license key under that subscription:

  • If it does, you can safely ignore this notification
  • If it does not, it should appear within 48 hours of the order being placed; if 48 hours have passed  submit a request to our Customer Care team

 

The submitted order price does not match the actual price for this order (Actual order value: X,XXX.XX)

The order must be resubmitted using the correct value.

 

Unhandled exception 'An error occurred while updating the entries. See the inner exception for details.'.

System timeout that may be a false negative. Check the subscription to see if the order was processed.

  • If it was not, wait a few minutes and click Try Again and it should go through
  • If it was, submit a request to our Customer Care team to manually update the order status and do not click Try Again

articles.name: How do I check the status of my order?
articles.title: How do I check the status of my order?
articles.body:
Overview 

You have placed an order through the GFI Web Shop, API or EDI and want to check the status of your order.

 

Details

  1. Log into GFI Accounts Portal
  2. Click on Manage on the left menu
  3. Then select the Orders tab
  4. Enter the purchase order number in the search field and press enter
  5. The corresponding order summary will appear in the results
  6. The order status will appear below the PO number

Orders that were not successfully processed will reflect a status of Rejected, Blocked, or Error

 

To access a detailed view of an order

To find out more about why your order was not successfully processed:

  1. Click on the Purchase Order (PO) number.
  2. This action will open the order page, which provides comprehensive information on the order error
  3. Refer to our list of common order failures.

articles.name: How to download a Kerio License file [Internal]

 When customers request a license .key file for software installation or after updates to their software license, the customer care team must provide the necessary .key file.

Visit the Kerio License Management Portal (KISS)

articles.name: How do I verify and process a Marketing Development Funds (MDF) credit memo request? [Internal]
articles.title: How do I verify and process a Marketing Development Funds (MDF) credit memo request? [Internal]
articles.body:
Situation

You receive a request to issue an MDF credit memo (CM) for a distributor.

 

Resolution

Verification

IMPORTANT: These mandatory verification steps must be actioned before processing.

Four things need to be checked:

  1. GFI 2024 MDF Planner: check the allocated quarterly budget for each partner (there should also be a CC comment in the relevant cell denoting how much has been used)
  2. GFI Invoices for Set Off: check if any/all of the budget has been used
  3. Proofs attached to the request: check what the MDF was used for and that it was actioned
  4. Date of the proofs: check that the MDF was for last quarter

How to proceed:

  • If the request is pertaining to the current quarter, deny it and ask them to resubmit next quarter
  • If the request is over budget, deny it quoting the available budget as a reminder
  • If all the budget has been used, deny the request citing the relevant CMs and quoting their total budget
  • If part of the budget has been used but the remaining budget does not cover the request, deny it citing the relevant CMs and quoting the remaining budget
  • If part of the budget has been used and the remaining budget covers the request, process it as below
  • If none of the budget has been used and the request is within budget, process it as below

Processing

Once you have verified the request, issue the CM in Zuora and save a copy in the MDF folder:

  1. Identify the correct Zuora account to generate the credit memo (e.g. A00005969)

    • Check other CMs for that partner or use the AP to find the proper USD account (in the partner's account > Advanced check under Zuora Accounts > Zuora Id (USD)

  2. Open the Zuora account, under Transactions > Credit Memos tab > Create Credit/Debit Memo and edit only the following:

    • Reason Code: MDF

    • Comments: from GFI Invoices for Set Off copy the PO and Vendor numbers and add them thusly:

      • PO No (NS): Q1 MDF 2023

      • Vendor Invoice No.: 96094

    • Click the Additional Item button (towards the bottom right) and on the pop-up:
      • Product: Miscellaneous
      • Rate Plan: Credit
      • click MDF SKU
    • On the row that appears:
      • Description: from GFI Invoices for Set Off copy the Quarter Year column (e.g. Q2 FY23)
      • Service Start Date: start of relevant quarter
      • Service End Date: start of relevant quarter
      • Unit price: from GFI Invoices for Set Off copy the amount from Vendor Invoice Amt column
  3. Click the Post button
  4. Add the CM number (including link to Zuora) and date to GFI Invoices for Set Off
  5. Find the relevant budget cell in the GFI 2024 MDF Planner righ-click -> Comment and add the value and the CM number next to it in parentheses. For example:

    Note: if a comment already exists do not resolve it to add yours; just add yours to it
  6. Click the Email Credit Memo button and confirm
    • Exception: for ClimbCS manually email FrancescaN@climbcs.com (not Linet or Invoices), as requested via email to Razvan Soranescu on 21 Aug 2023 
  7. Next to the Email Credit Memo button click the down arrow next to View > Credit Memo PDF
  8. Upload the saved PDF to the relevant quarter subfolder in the MDF folder

articles.name: How do I fix WorkSmart analytics not picking up detailed browser activity? [Internal]
articles.title: How do I fix WorkSmart analytics not picking up detailed browser activity? [Internal]
articles.body:
Situation

You have been informed the browser you are using has resulted in non-specific analytics data for WorkSmart.

 

Resolution

There are two solutions:

1. Switch to Chrome

Chrome is an easy-to-install, easy-to-use browser. If your current browser does not represent hours of  customisation and enhancements and you are not particularly attached to using it, installing and using Chrome is a simple choice.

2. Rename your current browser

If you have invested time and effort into your current browser and switching would be laborious, don't jump the gun and apply drastic --disable-features=IsolateOrigins,site-per-process type flags (Chrome has the same feature either way). Instead, simply rename your browser's executable.

For example, if you are using Brave on Windows 11:

  1. Open File Explorer and navigate to C:\Program Files\BraveSoftware\Brave-Browser\Application
  2. Change the name of brave.exe to chrome.exe
  3. Go to the taskbar pin you use to open Brave, right-click > right-click Brave > Properties
  4. Change Target to "C:\Program Files\BraveSoftware\Brave-Browser\Application\chrome.exe" (including the inverted commas)
  5. Click the Change Icon button and under Look for icons in this file: enter %ProgramFiles%\BraveSoftware\Brave-Browser\Application\chrome.exe and select the relevant icon.

WorkSmart will now record analytical data from your browser!

Note: Whenever you are prompted to restart the browser for updates, make sure to check C:\Program Files\BraveSoftware\Brave-Browser\Application to see if anything was affected (the taskbar pin should stop working in this case so repeat the above as necessary).

articles.name: How do I block or unblock an account in the Accounts Portal? [Internal]
articles.title: How do I block or unblock an account in the Accounts Portal? [Internal]
articles.body:
Situation

You need to block or unblock an account in the Accounts Portal.

 

Solution

To block an account

  1. Log in to the Accounts Portal
  2. Click on Manage > Accounts and use the search box to find the relevant account
    The search can be conducted using the company name, ID number (CID), email or domain with the "@" prefix e.g. @gfi.com
  3. From the list of companies, click the elipses on the relevant one and select View Account
  4. In the page that opens click the gear icon (top left) > Edit Details and in the pop-up window click the Advanced tab and disable the Enabled switch
  5.  Click the Additional tab and add a note in the Notes field in ALL CAPS with the following format:
    DISABLED date_today AS PER ticket_ref_number - DO NOT ENABLE WITHOUT BIZOPS APPROVAL
  6. Click Save

To unblock an account

Follow the same steps as above with the following differences:

  1. In step 4 change the switch to Enabled
  2. In step 5 remove only the note relevant to the block

articles.name: How do I create a Quote in the Accounts Portal?
articles.title: How do I create a Quote in the Accounts Portal?
articles.body:
Situation

You need to create a quotation PDF before placing an order.

 

Action

Note: This feature is only available for certain Distributor and Reseller accounts

Exinda/GFI ClearView orders: refer to How do I create a Quote for Exinda or GFI ClearView in the Accounts Portal?

Quotes exceeding 2999 seats: enter the max amount of 2999 in step 3 and click Next. In step 4 modify the number in the QUANTITY column to the desired amount and click Preview Order.

  1. Log in to the Accounts Portal and follow the regular order process for your order
  2. Instead of completing the order in step 4 click on Publish Quote

    Note: if you make changes in step 4 (for example, the quantity of one of the items), click the Preview Order button for the values to be updated and the Publish Quote button will reappear.
  3. On the confirmation dialogue, click Confirm then Go to Quote
  4. On the page that opens click Download Quote to download the PDF
  5. Make a note of the quote number (top right) for future reference

Note: You can find your order by going to Manage > Orders > Quotes button and using the search box to enter the quote number.

If you do not remember your quote number, leave the search box blank and scroll through the list to locate it.

Note: If you win the quote you can convert it into an order without reentering all the information, by following the instructions in How do I convert a Quote into an Order in the Accounts Portal?

articles.name: What should my knowledge base article be like? [Internal]
articles.title: What should my knowledge base article be like? [Internal]
articles.body:
Overview

You want to create a knowledge base article (KBA) with the correct layout, formatting, and content.

 

Details

Knowledge articles should have the following:

  • The article title should be in a question format and capitalised as a sentence
  • Two main titles using Heading 2:
    • Situation OR Overview: a description of the subject/issue that the article covers 
            ↓                    ↓ 
    • Solution OR Details: the action that needs to be taken to resolve the situation
  • Subtitles using Heading 3 (if necessary)
  • Links set to open in new tabs (where necessary)
  • As few words as possible
  • An instructional structure favouring a list of steps
  • Button text in bold, e.g. Confirm
  • Button icon description in italics e.g. gear icon
  • Limited/all-encompassing screenshots with annotations like red arrows/squares (they're mandatory but should take up space and can break step flow)
  • Add Labels (these are "tags" but for articles) under Article Settings
    • Start typing and if the label you want is listed, click on it
    • If the label you want is not listed, click "+ Add as new label" to add it
  • If it is for internal use only, it should be set as Visible to Agents and admins and "[Internal]" should be added to the end of the title
  • Uncheck the Open for comments box under Article Settings

Important: If you are copy-pasting an article into Zendesk:
1. Either right-click > Paste as plain text and redo the formatting manually or fix the layout and then click the </> icon, followed by the Clean up styles button (bottom right). This is important for guaranteeing consistent viewing and LLM results (see example below).
2. If the original author is still with us, set them as Author under Article Settings

 

Example of an expected KBA

How do I create a quote in the Accounts Portal?

articles.name: How do I place an order for a GFI Software product (new business, renewal or addon)?
articles.title: How do I place an order for a GFI Software product (new business, renewal or addon)?
articles.body:
Situation

You need to place an order for new business or for the renewal of a GFI Software product license.

Important Note: All orders (including new subscriptions, renewals, upgrades, and add-ons) are placed by Distributors only, using the GFI Web Shop.

If you are a Reseller, please place your order with a Distributor in your area.

If you are an End user, please place your order with a Reseller in your area.

 

Resolution

For video instructions, have a look at this Webshop Tutorial from our Partner Portal Academy's Training Courses.

Step 1: Update or Create

  1. Log in to the GFI Accounts Portal (or if you are already logged in, click here: GFI Web Shop)
  2. Click on the Webshop button to go to step 1 of the 4-step order process
    • For renewals select Update an existing subscription > enter the latest license key or subscription number in the search field > click on the details box that appears > click Next
    • For new subscriptions select Create a new subscription > select the desired product from the drop-down menu > click Next

 

 

Note: for renewals, if you have already opened the License or Subscription page for the one you want to renew you can click gear icon (top right) > Upgrade (Web Shop).

Or you can do it directly from the License or Subscription search page by clicking the vertical ellipses button on the same row as the relevant result > Upgrade (Web Shop).

In both cases, you will be taken straight to step 1 with the subscription preselected, ready to click on Next.

 

Step 2: Customer Tier

  1. If you selected Update an existing subscription in step 1, the Enduser and Reseller will be automatically selected in step 2:
    • Check they are correct and click Next
    • If they are not correct, click the x in the top right corner of the ones you want to replace and follow the steps for new subscriptions below
  2. If you selected Create a new subscription in step 1, the Enduser and Reseller will be blank
    • Use the Find an enduser and Find a reseller fields to search for the relevant accounts using either their email , their email domain preceded by an "@" (e.g. @gfi.com) or their Customer ID (CID) if you know it
    • Once you have found the relevant account, click on it to set the selection, and click Next

If you cannot find an account
1. It does not exist: follow the instructions in How do I create a Reseller account? (Distributors only) or How do I create an Enduser Account?
2. It is not visible to you: if you are certain the account exists but you cannot see it, submit a visibility request to our Customer Care team.

 

Step 3: Configure

  1. Click Term Length to select
    • Addon Only (No Renewal): to upgrade an existing subscription with addons
    • 1 Year / 2 Years / 3 Years: the desired length of time for the new subscription/renewal
  2. Depending on the Term Length selected and the product you will be able to:
    • Adjust the number of seats/users
    • Choose addons (active addons will be pre-selected)
  3. When ready, click Next

Orders exceeding 2999 seats: enter the max amount of 2999 and click Next. In step 4 (below) modify the number in the QUANTITY column to the desired amount and click Preview Order.

 

Step 4: Preview

  1. The preview page will display:
    • All the order data set from the previous steps
    • Itemised pricing information (if the order is for addons only the listed items may carry the Prorated tag, denoting that the final charge is adjusted to reflect the remaining time of the subscription)
    • The Promo Codes field for applying pre-approved discounts for government, education, charity or non-profit organisations
    • The total order value
  2. Once you have confirmed that everything is as expected, click Place Order
    Note: if you make any changes (for example, quantity of one of the items), click the Preview Order button for the values to be updated and the Place Order button will reappear.
  3. Enter your purchase order number in the pop-up box PO Number field
  4. Click Confirm
  5. Once the order has been successfully submitted, click Go to Order on the confirmation pop-up
  6. On the Order Details page you can monitor the progress of your order (you can close this page and access it again at a later time either by saving the URL or searching for the PO number under Manage > Orders)
    • Processed: the order has been successfully processed and the invoice has been automatically emailed to the on-file accounting address
      Note: if you did not receive the relevant invoice, go to the Orders page, search for the relevant order by PO number, click on the PO number and in the top right you will see the relevant invoice number; submit a request to our Customer Care team to resend you the relevant invoice.
    • Awaiting Approval: the order you placed needs approval to continue
    • Blocked/Error/Rejected: the order encountered an issue and a reason is given; refer to Why was my order not successfully processed? for explanations and solutions

articles.name: How do I generate a new license on an active SaaS/MSP subscription?
articles.title: How do I generate a new license on an active SaaS/MSP subscription?
articles.body:
Overview

Creating a new Software as a Service (SaaS) or Managed Service Provider (MSP) license from an active subscription is a straightforward process.

Important Note: the monthly billing cycle for these subscriptions runs between the 1st and 7th of each month. During this time, no new keys can be generated.

 

Details

  1. Sign in to the GFI Accounts Portal

  2. Click on Manage > Subscriptions tab

  3. Enter the subscription number in the search field

  4. When your subscription is listed click the verticle ellipses on the right > View Details

  5. Under the Active Products section, find the product you want to generate a new license for and click Update

  6. In the pop-up click Create New

  7. Set the required license settings, such as the Operating System or extensions

  8. Click Create New to generate the new license

502: Bad Gateway: if this error appears, it usually means there was a timeout in the Accounts Portal due to heavy backend traffic. This does not necessarily mean the request has not been queued. Wait 10-15 minutes and refresh the subscription page to see if the license has been created. If it does not appear after 30 minutes, please try again before submitting a ticket to our Customer Care team.

articles.name: How to remove users from your FMO Account? [Internal]
articles.title: How to remove users from your FMO Account? [Internal]
articles.body:
As of our communications from March 2023, Outbound Users have an individual cost.

First of all, what are Outbound users? Outbound users are all the users that don't have a DID assigned to them, as users with a DID are capable of both Outbound and Inbound pages, and their cost is included with the payment of the DID.

Users can be deleted following this steps:

  1. Log in to your FMO account through our site.
  2. Go to the Gear Icon on the menu at the top and click on Users
  3. The list of users will pop up on the left side with the details of the selected user on the right.
  4. You can search for the desired user to be deleted or scroll down to look for users to delete.
  5. Once you locate a user you want to delete, you should select the gear icon next to their email address and select the option to remove the user.
     
    NOTE: Suspending the user isn't good enough as it will still show as a user and will get counted.

articles.name: How to Disable and Enable Accounts in the Accounts Portal [Internal]
articles.title: How to Disable and Enable Accounts in the Accounts Portal [Internal]
articles.body:
This guide outlines the procedure for disabling or enabling accounts within the Accounts Portal as part of credit management measures. These actions are typically initiated by requests from the Finance Business Unit (BU) or Business Operations (BizOps).

 

This is the process of implementation of credit management blocks on specific accounts. These requests will come from Finance BU or BizOps

Logging In and Locating the Account

  • Access the portal and sign in with your credentials.
  • Click on “Manage” located in the left-side menu.
  • Select the “Accounts” tab to proceed.
  • Enter the customer ID into the search field to locate the specific account.

Viewing and Editing Account Detail

  • From the search results, identify the account in question. Click on the three blue vertical dots on the right side of the account entry.
  • Select “view account” from the dropdown menu to open the account details.

  • Click on the gear icon to the right of the account details.
  • Choose “edit details” from the options provided.

Adjusting Account Status

  • Navigate to the “advanced” tab within the account details.
  • Use the radio button to select either disable or enable for the account status.
  • Confirm the adjustment by clicking “save”.

Updating the Credit Management Blocked List

  • For Disabling Accounts: If the account is being disabled, add its name and customer ID to the internal list of blocked accounts.
  • For Enabling Accounts: Conversely, if an account is being re-enabled, remove it from the list of blocked accounts.

This process ensures that the Accounts Portal reflects the current credit management status of customer accounts, based on directives from Finance BU or BizOps. It's important to update the list of blocked accounts accurately to maintain an up-to-date record of account restrictions.
