articles.name: How can I update my Kerio Connect or Kerio Control OS or Hardware model?
articles.title: How can I update my Kerio Connect or Kerio Control OS or Hardware model?
articles.body:
Situation

You recently migrated your Kerio product instance to a different OS or Hardware model and when applying your license you receive an error saying that the license is not for this operating system or not for this hardware.

 

Resolution

  1. Log in to the GFI Accounts Portal and click Manage -> Licenses
  2. In the search field enter the relevant Kerio license key
  3. Click the ellipses on the right of the listing that appears -> Details
  4. On the right of the page that opens -> gear icon -> Change OS
  5. On the pop-up, select the desired OS or Hardware model series from the OS dropdown
    Note: if you select a Hardware model series you will also need to select the specific model from the Hardwar dropdown
  6. Click Change and wait for the confirmation dialogue to appear in the bottom right
  7. Download the license key file and apply it to your instance by following the instructions in How do I download my Kerio key file and manually apply it to my instance?

Note: depending on the switch that is made, the seats may be automatically adjusted

articles.name: Update Kerio OS/Hardware model in KISS and the Accounts Portal [Internal]
articles.title: Update Kerio OS/Hardware model in KISS and the Accounts Portal [Internal]
articles.body:
READ FIRST: The below process has been deprecated in favour of How can I update my Kerio Connect or Kerio Control OS or Hardware model?. This article has not been archived as it serves as a reference point to the logic behind the process. If processing a request, you should use the new process.

Situation

You have received a request to change the OS/Hardware (HW) for a Kerio License. For example, from Windows to Linux, Linux to MacOS, Linux to NG110 etc.

Note: Kerio Connect only has OS changes. OS and HW changes apply to Kerio Control licenses (and very rarely Kerio Operator). A HW license change may be from one model to another, from OS to HW and vice versa.

 

Action

Unlike other GFI products, changes to Kerio products must (for the most part) be actioned in KISS. Any changes made in the Accounts Portal (AP) are usually cosmetic and will have no practical effect on the license and are made purely to avoid confusion/follow-ups from the requester.

Important: The below changes will be reset at renewal to whatever is defined in Zuora, regardless of what is specified in KISS, the Accounts Portal or the renewal order (IPCST-95562). To renew using the updated parameters, the license can be migrated to a new subscription.

Note: If you do not have access to KISS, open a DSR specifying "Access to KISS". All info needed for account creation will be gathered by the actioning DSR agent.

 

Update the License in KISS

Important: Before proceeding with a license change, after logging in to KISS and locating the license, check the License changes history (bottom of the license page, left side menu) for recent OS changes and discuss with the relevant CAM if there have been more than one recent one without explanation

There are 4 possible requests:

  1. OS to OS
  2. OS to HW
  3. HW to OS
  4. HW to HW

 

OS to OS

OS licenses can be switched without issue from one OS to the other as they will retain their seats and there is no OS-based difference in pricing.

  1. Log in to KISS, find the license using the search box next to License numbers and licenses

  2. Check that the OS field under Product - current settings is set to Windows, Linux or MacOS

    Important: If OS is set to a HW model, stop here and follow the instructions in the HW to OS section

  3. Click on the Change registration data button

  4. Change the Operating system field to Windows, Linux or MacOS using the dropdown menu
  5. Click Save

  6. Click the License file download button, save the .key file and send it to the requester

  7. Update the license in the AP

 

OS to HW

OS licenses can be switched without issue to HW as they will retain their seats and there is no OS-based difference in pricing.

  1. Log in to KISS, find the license using the search box next to License numbers and licenses

  2. Click on the Change license settings button

  3. Choose the relevant model from the Select hardware dropdown menu

  4. Enter the ZD ticket number under Reason for this change and click Continue > Save!

  5. Back on the license page click the Activate button and wait for the page to refresh

  6. The Product - current settings section will now show the relevant HW series in the OS field and will list the specific HW model number in the List of extensions field

  7. Click the License file download button, save the .key file and send it to the requester

  8. Update the license in the AP

 

HW to OS

This usually happens when the hardware has failed or is being deprecated. Since hardware licenses often have unlimited seats, the seat number has to be adjusted to reflect the actual cost of the running license (extensions included).

Important: When making this change, adjust the seats strictly according to the list in step 4

  1. Log in to KISS, find the license using the search box next to License numbers and licenses

  2. Click on the Change license settings button

  3. Select hardware > No hardware
  4. Untick the Unlimited tick box and edit Enter number of user seats according to the hardware series:
    • NG1**: 10 seats
    • NG3**: 40 seats
    • NG5**: 85 seats
  5. If ticked, untick any NG*** enabler server boxes
  6. Enter the ZD ticket number under Reason for this change and click Continue > Save!
  7. Back on the license page click Activate and wait for the page to refresh
  8. The OS will revert to its default value; if this is not the desired OS, click Change registration data, select the desired Operating system (Windows/Linux/MacOS) > Save
  9. The license page will now show the desired OS
  10. Click the License file download button, save the .key file and send it to the requester
  11. Update the license in the AP

 

HW to HW

This usually happens when the hardware has failed or is being deprecated. Although hardware licenses often have unlimited seats, the cost depends on the model so depending on the direction of the switch, the seat number may have to be adjusted.

Important: How the license is updated will depend on whether the switch is to a higher model or does not have unlimited seats; step 3 is pivotal

  1. Log in to KISS, find the license using the search box next to License numbers and licenses

  2. Click on the Change license settings button

  3. Choose the relevant model from the Select hardware dropdown menu

  4. There are three possibilities for the next step:
    • If the model is of the same or lower series (e.g. NG300 → NG310, NG310 → NG110), the license can remain with Unlimited seats (and should still be updated in the AP)
    • If the license is for a limited number of seats then the series switch is irrelevant and the license should remain with the seats it has (and should still be updated in the AP)
    • If the model is of a higher series, the HW to OS rules apply; untick the Unlimited tick box and edit Enter number of user seats according to the switch:
      • NG1** → NG3**: change to 10 seats
      • NG3** → NG5**: change to 40 seats
  5. If ticked, untick any NG*** enabler server boxes
  6. Enter the ZD ticket number under Reason for this change and click Continue > Save!
  7. Back on the license page click Activate and wait for the page to refresh
  8. If changing series, the OS field will change to reflect the new model
  9. Click the License file download button, save the .key file and send it to the requester
  10. If the license hardware series was:
    • not changed: stop here
    • changed to higher: follow the steps in Update the license in the AP
    • changed to lower: follow the steps in Update the license in the AP, skipping steps 3 and 4

 

Update the License in the AP

Note: steps 3 and 4 can be skipped if no changes were made to the seat number

  1. Log in to the AP, go to Manage > Licenses and search for the license
  2. Click on the license link > View
  3. On the details page that opens click gear > Edit Details
    • If the seats were changed from unlimited, before proceeding to the next step click on Settings and disable Is Unlimited
  4. On the Overview tab fill in Seats 1 with the relevant number of seats > Save
  5. Back in the main details page that is now visible, click on Metadata > Edit
  6. Replace the text in the Operating System field with the relevant one from below:
    • HWANG100Series
    • HWANG300Series
    • HWANG500Series
    • Linux
    • MacOS
    • Windows
  7. Click Save

articles.name: How can I add or edit a credit card as a payment method?
articles.title: How can I add or edit a credit card as a payment method?
articles.body:
Situation

You would like to pay for your usage subscriptions via credit card or the credit card info on your account is wrong or outdated.

 

Resolution

Adding a credit card

If you are a Partner

Removing a credit card

Note: This option is only available if at least one active card is available on file (at least one has to be on file for FMO accounts or the account would be automatically deleted). To remove all on-file credit cards, submit an account cancellation request to our Customer Care team.

 

Marking a credit card as favourite

  1. Click the star icon on the relevant card:

articles.name: Process FMO Orders with the addition of Pages [Internal]
articles.title: Process FMO Orders with the addition of Pages [Internal]
articles.body:
1. You will receive a Zendesk ticket indicating a Zuora Subscription have been made. ie. FMO - Order (A-S00140104)
  2. Check the Zuora Subscription for details on the customer (End-user ID) under the additional information tab
  3. Check the customer details by entering the ID in the Accounts portal by clicking on the Manage section> Licenses to see the end-user's name:

    NOTE: Make sure you are viewing a FaxMaker online active subscription (It can be seen under the Product Header), as Etherfax shares the same SKUs, but is done in a whole different process. Additionally, make sure the expiration date isn’t very close to a year from now as it might be a duplicated case and the order already has been processed.

  4. Check the FMO portal for the account under the "Search for departments..." to confirm the account's name.

    Once found Click on the engine and "Login as selected Company":

    If they have different departments it would show under the main account and you would have to add them up to know how many Total users the account has.
    To know how many DIDs the account has, you click on the person with an arrow at the top right and select subscription, which will pop a square in the middle of the screen with all the details and show the total of Fax Numbers, on this account being 14.

    NOTE: 155 Total users - 14 DIDS equal 141 Outbound users and 14 Fax numbers.
    (because each DID has 1 outbound user assigned for free)
    NOTE: if there are 0 lines they are using the account for outgoing faxes only
    NOTE: if they have 10 total numbers but 6 are unassigned and the order is for 4, then we immediately remove the 6 unassigned
    NOTE: if they are trying to renew for more DIDs what area code they want to be in and then I email Concord please assign 2 DIDs with area code XXX/or region XXX to account Name and Product Instance ID. For the Distributor side, process the order first and then ask them for the area code preference (they might not actually want a number)

    NOTE: if they are trying to renew for more users we just do it, no questions
    NOTE: if they try to renew for less, we reject
    NOTE: check the proration dates to makes sure they are correct to the time of expiry

     

  5. Make sure the details match the ones in Zuora:
    Click Save and Preview and check that there is no proration.
    If there is proration, the date should be close to the actual renewal date.

  6. If the details matched (Or exceed) you can continue.

  7.  

    The amount in parentheses is the value added to FMO subscription regardless of discount:

    1. If there is a difference is due to DIDs check the FMO portal again to confirm if there are any unassigned DIDs. To do so you must click on dashboard and on the right section you will see how their DIDs are distributed:

      NOTE: In this case there isn't any unassigned numbers, so the order must be for 14 or more DIDs.

      1. In case they have unassigned DIDs check if the order is for the correct amount of assigned DIDs, if they are you can email psupport@concord.net
        and premiumsupport@concord.net to have the unassigned DIDs removed.
    2. If there's another reason, reject the order and ask the Distributor for the appropriate Order.
      To keep Zuora tidy, remember to delete the rejected Draft:
  8. Once everything is approved by you Go to Accounts portal, Under Home > Internal Cart > Review Subscription:

     

  9. search for the subscription:

     

     

  10. Review the order again and click on Activate:

  11. Click on confirm to complete the order and download the invoice to reconfirm the order

  12. Login to the FMO portal to check the updated balance for the customer’s subscription:

  13. Respond to the ticket updating the name with the PO number and letting them know their invoice number and that the order has been processed.

  14. Mark the Zendesk ticket as Solved

articles.name: How can I reset my GFI Accounts Portal password or set it for the first time?
articles.title: How can I reset my GFI Accounts Portal password or set it for the first time?
articles.body:
Overview

You have forgotten your password or you need to set it for the first time.

Note: You have a three-hour window to complete the below password reset process from the moment you initiate it.

Solution

  1. Go to accounts.gfi.com/ForgotPassword
  2. Type your email address into the Email field
  3. Click Send
  4. Go to your email account and locate the email from GFI Software
    Note: If you don't see the email in your Inbox, check the Junk or SPAM folder
  5. Click on the link provided in the email to proceed with resetting your password
  6. Once you're directed to the password reset page, enter your new password twice to confirm it.
  7. Click Reset to finalize the change.

Log In with Your New Credentials

  1. Return to the GFI Accounts Portal login page
  2. Enter your email and the new password you've just set

articles.name: How can I apply a pre-approved discount when placing an order for a government, education, charity or non-profit organisation?
articles.title: How can I apply a pre-approved discount when placing an order for a government, education, charity or non-profit organisation?
articles.body:
Situation

For select, pre-approved government, education, charity, or non-profit entities a 15% discount may be available. You would like to apply this discount while placing an order through the GFI Web Shop.

Important Note About Approval: To avoid unnecessary delays or issues, it is important to confirm all discounts with your Channel Account Manager before applying them to your order and only proceed once the discount has been approved.

 

Resolution

On Step 4: Preview of the ordering process locate the Promo Codes field at the bottom left.

 

For Government and Education Discounts:

  • Enter the promo code GE-15 in the Promo Codes field
  • Click the Preview Order button to apply it

For Charity and Non-Profit Discounts:

  • Enter the promo code CNP-15 in the Promo Codes field
  • Click the Preview Order button to apply it

articles.name: Order is processed but pending license [Internal]
articles.title: Order is processed but pending license [Internal]
articles.body:
When encountering a warning message regarding a missing license on a subscription, the first step is to check if the subscription already has a license. Sometimes, the license might not generate immediately but will appear later. If no license is found, follow the steps below to generate one and resolve the issue.

Steps to Generate a License

  1. Open the Order:

    • Click on the URL provided in the ticket to open the order.
    • Copy the subscription number from the order page.

  2. Navigate to GFI Accounts Portal:

    • Click on Manage, then select Licenses from the menu.

  3. Search for the Subscription:

    • Paste the subscription number into the search bar and perform the search.
    • When the subscription pops up in the results, click on it to proceed.

  4. Access Subscription Details:

    • A right-side pop-up will appear with the subscription details.
    • Click on View to access the full subscription page.

  5. Update the License:

    • On the subscription page, locate the Update button (inside the subscription information box).
    • Click the Update button, which will open a License Activation Wizard pop-up.
    • In the wizard, click Update again to begin syncing the license from KISS.

  6. Handle Errors During Sync:

    • If a "Bad Gateway" error appears:
      • Retry the update process.
      • If the issue persists, wait and try again later until the license sync is successful.

Post-License Generation Steps

  1. Once the license is updated and synced, revisit the ticket and resolve the order issue.
  2. Add a comment in the ticket noting "Done" for record-keeping.
  3. Close the ticket.
